name: AVANI Kalutara Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel over the Easter period and fully enjoyed it. We stayed in a suite it was beautiful with views over the lagoon and the sea. The hotel staff were very friendly, the food was plentifull if a little luke warm at times.
reviews.title: Fantastic Wedding

reviews.text: We chose to get married while out there and we couldn't of asked for a better day. Watshala the wedding co ordinator was very laid back which scared me at first but she had everything under contrloe and accommodated any requests we had. The Sri Lankan ceremony was beautiful with the decorated area and the elephant. There was just the two of us getting married we never took any family with us but our special guests of honour who were at our wedding Sharon, Barry, Chris & Steve (other guests at the hotel) made our day special too by celebrating our wedding with us, thanks you lot x.
reviews.title: Kalutara, Kani Lanka Resort, Mark & The Beach Boys - All in All a Wonderful Experience!!!

reviews.text: We went on the Kings of Kandy 2 day trip with First Choice it was ok, the hotel we stayed at was pretty basic compared to Kani Lanka and they tried to fit too much into 2 days, spice garden, botanical garden, elephant orphanage, Budda temple,show at the budda temple, gem factory, tea factory & tea plantations it was very exhausting and not getting lunch until 3pm when you set off at 7.30am is not very good.
reviews.title: Had a fantastic holiday at this wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a facial and manicure at the spa the day before I got married it was a relaxing experience well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Serene...

reviews.text: All in all it was a wonderful experience and we are glad we chose Sri Lanka to get married I would thouroghly recomend it, it's stress free. We couldn't fault the hotel or the staff and nobody bothered us for tips.
reviews.title: FEMALES......Beaware of staying at this hotel alone!

reviews.text: I'm a Sri Lankan & was at Kani Lanka for a weekend.We booked a triple & I specifically told them I didn't want a folding bed as the 3rd bed. They promised to give me a normal bed & when I got there it was a folding bed & Like a hospitel bed. I was dissappointed But, didn't say anything about it. Then when I asked if it was an all inclusive package, The answer I got was that the all inclusive pckage was only for the foreign guests.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, Lousy staff.
A great holiday
reviews.text: Why what's wrong with us Sri Lankans? Shouldn't you cater for those in your country first? I was very upset with this attitude.Did one think that Sri Lankans drink too much or what? When I left the hotel I had accidently left my Face wash & body wash, both branded items. I called back to ask if they found it in the room. Wathsala promised to call me back, but never did, I called them back, then she said she was too busy to call. The answer I got was, that it wasn't found, which I thought was strange as any hotel in Sri Lanka holds items they find in guests rooms for at least 2 weeks before they throw it away. It's just not possible that they could not have found what I left behind in the room. All in all, It's a beautiful hotel. I would say one of the best down south. Location is perfect with the most wonderful settings & rooms, but the staff are not too friendly towards Sri Lankans & I think they find it hard to be nice & helpful to Sri Lankans & I'm sure they make an extra effort to be nice to the foreign guests. You should be nice to your own first & not treat them like the poor relations. We too spend money at your hotel & do expect the best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The woollys of Hampshire we stayed at this fabulous hotel in april 2009 and had a great holiday, we had read the reviews and were a little apprehensive but realise the reviews are from a vast amount of experiences good and bad. the hotels location was pretty central most places of interests were a few hours away but well worth it,the hotel staff were very friendly ,it was clean we found it relaxing and enjoyed the lovely food and felt it was varied,plenty of selection. We booked our trips through a local man Santha Kumara [---] also on [---] who we found very reliable and helpful nothing was to much trouble, his prices were reasonable and his tourism knowledge was good he would take you anywhere you wanted to go even to change money,we used him all of the time and were really impressed any long trips were made in air condtioned vehicles.The beach was a bit disappointing no doubt the sunami had taken away the white sand the replacement seemed a coarser sand and the sea was a bit rough, but santha to the rescue 25mins away in a tuk tuk was bentota beach really lovely and picturesque.A very enjoyable holiday a trip to the elephant orphanage is a must what a fantastic place they have!
reviews.title: Great hotel and great holiday

reviews.text: We have just come back from 10 days in Sri Lanka at the Kani Lanka. This is a very good hotel and represents really good value for money. Yes the hotel is quite remote, the beach isn't the best and the sea is rough but I think they have cottoned onto this and price All Inclusive at the same rate as half board in other hotels further down the coast (with Dreamtickets anyway, think First Choice is more expensive).
reviews.title: Beautiful, Peaceful and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was delicious and the different nationality themes each night mean there is variety. Coupled with the free drinks you will end up stuffing your face and we had to make several visits to the gym! Staff are really helpful and friendly and you feel very spoiled. The wine is very expensive but I think it is generally in Sri Lanka as they have to import it. They haven't quite got the hang of making European desserts but they're ok and by the time you get to dessert you are forcing it down you are so full. The rooms are good apart from the bathroom which could do with redecorating but it's not like you spend loads of time in there.
reviews.title: Kani Lanka Hotel and Kanutari.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel following a tour of Sri Lanka. It was supposed to be a rest and relaxation period before going home. We arrived in the early evening and were placed in a ground floor room (we had booked superior balcony room). The room was small but clean with a shower room. I walked out of the french doors onto the patio to be greeted by a tout standing 10 yards away behind a barrier made of a single piece of string stretched between canes. He immedately started trying to sell me trips. From where he stood he had an uninterupted view into our room so we had to close the curtains to maintain privacy. We complained and were put in a balcony room the next day. This room was exactly the same as the other but neither could be classed as superior. I would hate to think what the standard rooms are like.
reviews.title: Not what you would expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is not private and is separated from the hotel by the string barrier which is manned all day by upwards of 15 touts. The pool area is only about 10 mtrs from this barrier and so you have to spend the day sunbathing around the pool with all these touts standing at the barrier and staring across and shouting to guests.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Would Go Back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is mostly good and varied and we had a special meal on the river deck of the hotel which was excellent but the service outside the dining room is very slow. Unfortunatly the dining room has no outside seating.
reviews.title: great hotel, average food, indifferent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was very good and well appointed.
reviews.title: Perfect Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel does not meet its star rating in any way. I have stayed in much better cheaper hotels with better facilities and service. Its location would be superb if were not for the fact that you have to share the beach and pool area with the touts
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and amazing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm very slow in writing this as our stay was in April, We had two weeks there and loved it.
reviews.title: Wonderful place would definately return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent , high quality and varied, the pool is beautiful, the staff helpful (particularly Ravi the head of catering ).
reviews.title: Far Better Than I Expected For The Price We Paid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really do not understand why some people nitpick and whinge so much, the rooms are pleasant enough but a little small. We booked a superior room but all this means is that you get a beach or lagoon view, so if you have done your homework you will know this already and decide whether it's worth the extra dosh. Our superior room sprung a leak through the air con one night and the staff were extremely helpful and upgraded us to a suite for our last two nights, this was lovely.
reviews.title: lovely hotel / resort but a few issues
Great two weeks
reviews.text: I really don't know how people can complain about the food?? it is very good , the moaners should remember that they are in Asia and food prep techniques and availability is different to Europe so the food is bound to be slightly different to what we are used to , but surely that's one of the reasons we go abroad isn't it to broaden our horizons and try different things, my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the food.

As for begging for tips, and pestering pool boys and touts, I can honestly say we never had any of this at all, I did not see a tout but, maybe this is because my hubby is Sri Lankan, maybe they avoided us.
reviews.title: amazing kani lanka

description: Breathe in that fresh sea air and feel the warmth of the sun against your skin. Before you, lies the ocean; behind you, the Kalu Ganga river, twisting almost 100 miles back to Sri Pada, the sacred mountain believed to be the footprint of the Buddha. Where the river meets the ocean, you'll find AVANI Kalutara Resort, and discover a place where your dreams of an island paradise come true.. This hotel was formely known as Kani Lanka Resort & Spa. Skim the white waves of the Indian Ocean on board a traditional fishing boat, or watch the sunlight glitter on the water as you kayak along the riverside... it's almost like you're paddling through diamonds. Later, draw close to the warmth of the beach-side fire and share stories of another incredible day. Savour every bite of that juicy fresh seafood and enjoy a sunset that's beautiful beyond belief...
